quiz.title: Economics: Market Structures, Elasticity, and Resource Allocation

questions.question: The major difference between perfect competition and monopolistic competition is:
questions.explanation: In monopolistic competition, firms sell differentiated (nonâ€‘identical) products, whereas in perfect competition products are homogeneous.

questions.question: If an increase in price leads to an increase in total revenue, this shows that demand is:
questions.explanation: When demand is inelastic, the percentage decrease in quantity demanded is smaller than the percentage increase in price, so total revenue rises.

questions.question: The problem of allocation of resources is concerned with:
questions.explanation: Resource allocation addresses which goods and services (and in what quantities) an economy will produce given scarce resources.

questions.question: Firms owned by two or more individuals is known as:
questions.explanation: A partnership is a business structure owned and operated by two or more persons who share profits and liabilities.
